intro: Toxocarpus barbatus, commonly known as the hairy leaf vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. Toxocarpus barbatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
